wikipedia_page.main: John Martin (10 December 1904 – March 1984), known as Jack Martin, was an English footballer who played as an outside left in the Football League for Darlington, Leeds United, Accrington Stanley, Bury and Doncaster Rovers. He was on the books of Reading, without playing League football for them, and played non-league football for Hebburn Colliery, Connahs Quay & Shotton – with whom he won the Welsh Cup in 1929 – and Guildford City.
